version_description:
This is a big update for Cairn:
- Vastly improved search
- Popular trails: See waypoints and trail stats for 4000+ routes in North America
- Better access to elevation info  
- Sunset alert: We give you a warning ahead of time

This is a slight update to our big update of a few days ago:
- Vastly improved search
- See waypoints and trail stats for 4000+ popular routes in North America
- Better access to elevation info  
- Sunset alert
- Option to pause tracking
- Trailhead demarcation
- One tap to download map for your whole trail 
- As always, some bug fixes

- View your downloaded map areas
- Know if you've already downloaded an offline map
Just a small improvement this time! Now you can use search for trails even while you're recording your track or have notified your safety contacts.

- More trail data: Now featuring new hiking trails in UK and Canada. And all of the Appalachian trail.
- Faster and more flexible search

- More trail data. We've been adding in the trails where you (Cairn users) have been going lately. If your trail ETA wasn't included before, it may be now!
- Improved search: It's now faster and easier to find more obscure places.

-Offline map manager lets you view map sizes and delete unwanted maps.
-Faster map loading and responsiveness

We've added a number of new trails, including ones that lead to fantastic spots for catching August's solar eclipse. Daniel wrote in and requested trails in Shenandoah National Park so we added a slew of trails there as well. 

If you're enjoying Cairn, think about leaving us a review. Happy trails!
Get driving directions to trailheads with just one tap. It makes planning that much easier.

-We added 109 new trails. Most are in the US but some in British Columbia as well.
-Fixed a crashing bug.
We added more trails and some enhancements to the safety notification process.
We've added about 25 new trails. Gumjuwac Saddle, Kaskaskia Canyon and Beinn Eilideach are just a few of them (we love the names!).

We've added some new trails for your offline use. Of these, Mount Assiniboine is our favorite name. We've also fixed a few bugs, including one that would cause your stat tracking to stop if you were stationary for too long. 

Happy trails!
New trails in the Dolomites!

- We've included an in-app 'how to use this app' tutorial
- We've added whole slew of new trails. 
- Now you can put the map in 'follow' mode (the map will rotate and follow your position). Just tap the current location button twice!

We've heard from a number of you about trails that you'd like to see added and so we've obliged. You'll find over 300 new trails complete with elevation and ETA data. We've also added some in-app-purchase options. We are hoping for your support so that we can continue to add more features (and trails) in the future!

Now you can export your recorded track as a .gpx file, just as many of you have asked. As usual we've also added a few hundred new trails. Pickens Nose, a trail in the Southern Blue Ridge Mountains of North Carolina, has the best name of the bunch.  If there are trails you want to see added to Cairn, email us at adventure@cairnme.com with your request.
We fixed a bug with the new .gpx track export feature.
A few minor updates to keep Cairn up to date, including updating Facebook sign in.
A few minor updates to make Cairn look even better, especially on iPhone X.

You'll find a legion of new trails in this version of the app. Areas include Mont Blanc, Las Vegas + Southern Nevada, Mesa Verde National Park, Washington's Olympic Peninsula, Mt. Kilimanjaro, Machu Picchu, Sagarmatha National Park, Rocky Mountains, Marin + North Bay, Banff, Iceland, Great Sand Dunes, Capitol Reef, Great Basin, Jemez Mountains, Black Hills, Los Angeles, Blue Ridge Mountains, Mt Baker, Uluru, Cairngorms, Skagit Range, Hood Canal, Scottish Highlands and 52 more areas (!). 

As always, if there are trails you'd like to see us add to Cairn, just let us know at adventure@cairnme.com.

- Your track stats, totaled: See how far and high you've hiked this month, this year, and since you started using Cairn. 
- New trails in British Columbia.

Now you can get an estimated time of arrival based on your activity and speed. Activity options include hiking, mountain biking, skiing, snow travel, horseback riding and running as activity options. As usual, we've added some new trails from all over the world including a number located in British Columbia.

You'll find additional trails from all over the world in this latest version of the app. We now have the Cape Town area in South Africa covered! You'll also find a number of new trails in the Anza-Borrego / Joshua Tree area of California. If you'd like to request that we add a trail or two, please send us a note at adventure@cairnme.com.
We now have a fix for those of you who were not able to enter your contact's UK phone number. Thanks to Faye for alerting us to this issue!

You'll find even more trails from all over the world in this latest version of the app. We have added trails located in Western Cape (South Africa), Trinity Alps (California), Mt. Hood (Oregon), Bellingham (Washington), Spain, and South Dakota. If you'd like to request that we add a trail or two to the app, please send us a note at adventure@cairnme.com.
We've added trails in Australia, Canada, Madagascar, New Zealand, Switzerland, UK, and the US (in Alaska, Arizona, California, Colorado, Kentucky, Maryland,  Michigan and Washington).

Fellow adventurers! We've fixed a couple important bugs and added a few of our favorite hikes in Norway. We've also launched a beta program for the Android version of Cairn, so please tell your friends with Android phones to download it at www.cairnme.com/get-android.
We've updated some trails in Washington, namely the Devil's Dome trail loop in the Pasayten Wilderness and the trail to Glacier Basin.
Laying the groundwork for some upcoming features.
Adding support for those of you using iOS 12.

Now you can find and share your current location coordinates (after giving permission, of course). You can also now see when the sun will rise and set; just look in the main menu for this info. Also, when you are recording a track, Cairn collects your cell coverage status and displays it all along your recorded trail. You can then access your saved track's cell coverage data later in your profile.
We've refreshed the design of the topo map! If you look carefully, you'll find many little changes that make the map faster to read and understand. There are a couple bug fixes in there as well.
